flags.name: admin_host
flags.description: Host name to which the admin server should bind. (default: localhost)

flags.name: admin_port
flags.description: Port to which the admin server should bind. (default: 8000)

flags.name: allow_skipped_files
flags.description: Make files specified in the app.yaml "skip_files" or "static" handles readable by the application. (default: true)

flags.name: api_host
flags.description: Host name to which the server for API calls should bind. (default: localhost)

flags.name: api_port
flags.description: Port to which the server for API calls should bind. (default: random available port)

flags.name: appidentity_email_address
flags.description: Email address associated with a service account that has a downloadable key. May be None for no local application identity.

flags.name: appidentity_private_key_path
flags.description: Path to private key file associated with service account (.pem format). Must be set if appidentity_email_address is set.

flags.name: auth_domain
flags.description: Name of the authorization domain to use. (default: gmail.com)

flags.name: application
flags.description: Set the application, overriding the application value from the app.yaml file.

flags.name: automatic_restart
flags.description: Restart instances automatically when files relevant to their module are changed. (default: true)

flags.name: blobstore_path
flags.description: Path to directory used to store blob contents. (default: a subdirectory of --storage_path)

flags.name: clear_datastore
flags.description: Clear the datastore on startup. (default: false)

flags.name: clear_prospective_search
flags.description: clear the prospective search subscription index. (default: false)

flags.name: clear_search_indexes
flags.description: Clear the search indexes. (default: false)

flags.name: datastore_consistency_policy
flags.description: The policy to apply when deciding whether a datastore write should appear in global queries. (default: time)

flags.name: datastore_path
flags.description: Path to a file used to store datastore contents. (default: a file in --storage_path)

flags.name: default_gcs_bucket_name
flags.description: Default Google Cloud Storage bucket name.

flags.name: dev_appserver_log_level
flags.description: The log level below which logging messages generated by the development server will not be displayed on the console (this flag is more useful for diagnosing problems in dev_appserver.py rather than in application code). (default: info)

flags.name: enable_sendmail
flags.description: Use the "sendmail" tool to transmit e-mail sent using the Mail API (ignored if --smtp_host is set). (default: false)

flags.name: enable_task_running
flags.description: Run "push" tasks created using the taskqueue API automatically. (default: true)

flags.name: host
flags.description: Host name to which application modules should bind. (default: localhost)

flags.name: jvm_flag
flags.description: Additional arguments to pass to the java command when launching an instance of the app. May be specified more than once. Example: --jvm_flag=-Xmx1024m --jvm_flag=-Xms256m

flags.name: log_level
flags.description: The log level below which logging messages generated by application code will not be displayed on the console. (default: info)

flags.name: logs_path
flags.description: Path to a file used to store request logs. (default: a file in --storage_path if not set)

flags.name: max_module_instances
flags.description: The maximum number of runtime instances that can be started for a particular module - the value can be an integer, in which case all modules are limited to that number of instances, or a comma-separated list of module:max_instances, e.g. default:5,backend:3.

flags.name: mysql_host
flags.description: Host name of a running MySQL server used for simulated Google Cloud SQL storage. (default: localhost)

flags.name: mysql_password
flags.description: Password to use when connecting to the MySQL server specified in --mysql_host and --mysql_port or --mysql_socket.

flags.name: mysql_port
flags.description: Port number of a running MySQL server used for simulated Google Cloud SQL storage. (default: 3306)

flags.name: mysql_socket
flags.description: Path to a Unix socket file to use when connecting to a running MySQL server used for simulated Google Cloud SQL storage.

flags.name: mysql_user
flags.description: Username to use when connecting to the MySQL server specified in --mysql_host and --mysql_port or --mysql_socket

flags.name: port
flags.description: Lowest port to which application modules should bind. (default: 8080)

flags.name: prospective_search_path
flags.description: Path to a file used to store the prospective search subscription index. (default: a file in --storage_path if not set)

flags.name: require_indexes
flags.description: Generate an error on datastore queries that requires a composite index not found in index.yaml. (default: false)

flags.name: search_indexes_path
flags.description: Path to a file used to store search indexes. (default: a file in --storage_path if not set)

flags.name: show_mail_body
flags.description: Logs the contents of e-mails sent using the Mail API. (default: false)

flags.name: skip_sdk_update_check
flags.description: Skip checking for SDK updates (if not set, use .appcfg_nag to decide). (default: false)

flags.name: smtp_allow_tls
flags.description: Allow TLS to be used when the SMTP server announces TLS support (ignored if --smtp_host is not set). (default: true)

flags.name: smtp_host
flags.description: Host name of an SMTP server to use to transmit e-mail sent using the Mail API.

flags.name: smtp_password
flags.description: Password to use when connecting to the SMTP server specified with --smtp_host.

flags.name: smtp_port
flags.description: Port number of an SMTP server to use to transmit e-mail sent using the Mail API (ignored if --smtp_host is not set). (default: 25)

flags.name: smtp_user
flags.description: Username to use when connecting to the SMTP server specified with --smtp_host.

flags.name: storage_path
flags.description: Path to the data (datastore, blobstore, etc.) associated with the application.

flags.name: threadsafe_override
flags.description: Override the application's threadsafe configuration - the value can be a boolean, in which case all modules threadsafe setting will be overridden or a comma-separated list of module:threadsafe_override e.g. "default:False,backend:True"

flags.name: use_mtime_file_watcher
flags.description: Use mtime polling for detecting source code changes - useful if modifying code from a remote machine using a distributed file system. (default: false)
